rationale: The agent's changes are incomplete and less correct than the ground truth. Ground truth properly removes all implementation code and helper methods, leaving only the method signature with parameter validation (lines 60-62), and removes unused imports (java.io.IOException, java.nio.file.Path, java.util.Optional). The agent replaces the entire executeTask() method body with a no-op comment, removing necessary parameter validation logic that should remain. Additionally, the agent keeps the IOException declaration in the method signature when it's no longer needed (ground truth removes it). Most critically, the agent fails to delete the SetCompatibleVersionsTaskTests.java test file entirely, which ground truth removes. The agent also removes one more import than needed (java.io.IOException) but this is a minor issue. The approach of leaving a no-op comment is questionable when the ground truth shows a cleaner approach of keeping minimal validation logic. The missing test file deletion is a major completeness issue.
